logic.platformer

Class BasicAIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.platformer.BasicAIController

  • public class BasicAIController
extends java.lang.Object
    This will controls the behaviour of the specified character the way you want to. It will perform whatever actions you specify at a specified frequency.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicAIController(BasicCharacter character)
      Well we can't have AI without specifying which character it is for after all.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void random()
      Basic random AI movement, with jumping involved.
      void randomNoJump()
      Basic AI movement without any jumping involved.
      void setActivity(int activity)
      Must be in range from 1 to 100, the higher the range, the more active the character.
      void setChoiceDuration(int minChoiceDuration, int maxChoiceDuration)
      The duration of actions that character will take.
      void setJumpFParameters(int jumpFrequency, int jumpChance)
      Sets up jumping behaviour.
      void setRange(int minRange, int range)
      The range within which the character can move.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicAIController

        public BasicAIController(BasicCharacter character)
        Well we can't have AI without specifying which character it is for after all.
        Parameters:
        character - Character who will be controlled by AI.

    • Method Detail

      • randomNoJump

        public void randomNoJump()
        Basic AI movement without any jumping involved.

      • random

        public void random()
        Basic random AI movement, with jumping involved.

      • setActivity

        public void setActivity(int activity)
        Must be in range from 1 to 100, the higher the range, the more active the character.
        Parameters:
        activity - The rate of activity of the given character.

      • setChoiceDuration

        public void setChoiceDuration(int minChoiceDuration,
                     int maxChoiceDuration)
        The duration of actions that character will take. Smaller range will result in more rapidly changing and seizurelike character. Make sure that minimum choice duration is smaller than max choice duration.
        Parameters:
        minChoiceDuration - Minimum duration to hold the action.
        maxChoiceDuration - Maximum duration to hold the action.

      • setRange

        public void setRange(int minRange,
            int range)
        The range within which the character can move. Very useful to keep character on the platform.
        Parameters:
        minRange - The left side range for the character. The left x.
        range - The range from the left side, the width.

      • setJumpFParameters

        public void setJumpFParameters(int jumpFrequency,
                      int jumpChance)
        Sets up jumping behaviour. For truly random jumping I would recommend setting frequency to low and chance to high.
        Parameters:
        jumpFrequency - How frequently the character will jump.
        jumpChance - The chance of jumping. The higher the number the less likely the character is to jump.
